doc.field: Microelectronics and Computer Technology Corp> said its board approved a restructuring of its advanced computer architecture program. The private sector cooperative research venture, which is owned by 20 U.S. companies, said the restructuring is based on a study by its technical advisory board. The study occurred due to changing requirements, the company said. Formerly comprised of four separate projects, the program will now have a central resaerch core and three laboratories called satellites. The work in the core program will focus on long-range research, the company said. Reuter
